Running eclipse -vmargs -Dfoo results in a crash with the following dump:

java(896,0xa000cf80) malloc: java(896,0x1804600) malloc: *** error for object 0x342020: i*** error for object 0x342020: incorrect checksum for freed objencorrect checksum for freed object - object was probably modifiect - object was probably modified after being freed, break at szd after being freed, break at szone_error to debug
one_error to debug
java(896,0xa000cf80) malloc: java(896,0x1804600) malloc: *** set a breakpoint in szone_er*** set a breakpoint in szone_error to debug
ror to debug

Intel Mac, OS X 10.4.5, JDK 1.5.0_06-111, Eclipse 3.2M6
Steve, can you feed me the complete command line that you're using...my simple test worked for me.

(In reply to comment #1)
> Steve, can you feed me the complete command line that you're using...my simple
> test worked for me.
> 

./eclipse -vmargs -Dfoo

I verified that the problem also exists on a coworkers PowerBook G4, also running JDK 1.5.0_06-111. I was able to get a litte more info on the console this time:

Exception in thread "Thread-17" org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Invalid thread access
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3374)
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3297)
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3268)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.error(Widget.java:650)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.checkWidget(Widget.java:328)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.internal_new_GC(Control.java:1303)
        at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.GC.carbon_new(GC.java:163)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Label.drawWidget(Label.java:185)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.kEventControlDraw(Widget.java:995)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.controlProc(Widget.java:349)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.controlProc(Display.java:830)
java(319,0x1804600) malloc: *** error for object 0x341b00: double free
java(319,0x1804600) malloc: *** set a breakpoint in szone_error to debug
Invalid memory access of location 00000000 eip=9170a10f

You need the -XstartOnFirstThread VM arg. Reopen this bug report if you can't get it to work.

See http://www.eclipse.org/swt/macosx/ for more details about how to run SWT on the Mac (if you are interested, there is more detail there than you need).
Changing OS from Mac OS to Mac OS X as per bug 185991
